channel.title: Mars
channel.description:
Yesterday i had free time before school so i watched the Science channel as it interests me, a lot. On it was a program called "Exploration Mars", or something similar.
It talked about Mars in the (near) future and how in as soon as 2020 people could live there. First they were going to send a ship with no-one on it to Mars that would create fuel using Mars's atmosphere and the chemicals in it to refuel another ship containing humans for the journey back (Less weight). That's for exploring purposes.
What interested me was how they talked about making Global Warming happen on Mars to increase the temperature and alter the pressure of its atmosphere so humans would soon be able to live on mars only having to wear oxygen suits. (Not the giant pressure suit things). The temperature increase would melt frozen Ice and water would start spreading, again (they're assuming)- After that they were considering taking plant life there and growing tree's and such as the chemicals there are perfect for plants and oxygen for humans. It'd take a while to grow them all and spread the oxygen- But it's quite amazing.
Then maybe take animals there from our world and ect. If there were any organisms frozen in the ice or such, they may have a chance of living again. There's your Martians. :P
They showed a detailed version of what it might look like, looked really cool. Like a 2nd Earth.
Very interesting. Just thought it'd be a worthy discussion.
What do you think about this?

item.title: Mars
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

[quote=“Gotta Catch Them All, post:17, topic:106584”][quote author=Gotta Catch Them All link=topic=152588.msg1451807#msg1451807 date=1181341211]

People always said that mars was a livable planet on = )

Since when?
[/quote]

No one has answered me yet.[/quote]

They’ve only been on this subject for a few years now as I’m thinking. So not long.But then again I could be wrong.

Russians should be the first to look more into this. imo they’re so smart in this shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Mars
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

goatee:

How about not paying for the 400 billion it would cost for a giant thingy. Why not just make it free?

How can they make it free? The 400 Billion goes towards all the building and stuff.
The first project, they wanted to build a space station on the moon, build the rocket there and then send it to Mars.

But they’ve made it way smaller, now, and it’s a direct launch from earth.

Read full topic

item.title: Mars
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:7, topic:106584”]The USA is the number one polluter and probably cause for global warming.

Anyway, Jupiter or something has a moon full of ice, once it’s melted it could be the planet after mars.[/quote]

They should’ve signed the kyoto agreement.

But if they were to make it a livable planet, the cost would be so high for a person to get on a ship to travel there.

item.title: Mars
item.dc:creator: @SETO SETO
item.description:
@SETO wrote:

it is posible creating a life suporting mars, but i doubt about the water, i don’t think the frozen ice is H2O, ( i remeber reading it in some newspaper). also mars atmostphare is so thin it would be hit by many space rocks (not like earth where the atmostphare will burn it)

close to topic: i’ve read in a newspaper that in about 10 or 15 years they are planning to camp out on the moon. (humans of course)

i’d rather be intrested if they try to travel 21 or so light years to visit the super earth (i know it’s gona take ages but hey Nasa try doing something about finding life in super earth)

Read full topic

item.description:
@LeScape_Pk wrote:

no one cares about space anymore
space is the future of living..it's not deniable. Earth is being consumed so fast, we're going to have to go elsewhere, even if it's not ready.

item.title: Mars
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

Original Daniel:

It has been talked about forever, nothing will happen anytime soon.

That’s because it’s been planned.
Those 2 guys created this idea back in around 1990? Or something and arn’t starting it till 2016. (I think, if memory serves me well).

At first it was a giant mission by Nasa, but would have costed an estimate of 400 Billion- So they made it smaller, it was denied again, then smaller, denied.
Then these two guys made it as small as possible but very efficient. (Sending 1 rocket for refueling, ect)

Read full topic

It has been talked about forever, nothing will happen anytime soon.

item.title: Mars
item.dc:creator: @marluxia marluxia
item.description:
@marluxia wrote:

Jupiter’s moon (Europa), is way too far from the sun (well at least at the moment). As for Mars yes we could probably colonize it by the end of the century but the will power is lacking, no one cares about space anymore

Read full topic

item.title: Mars
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

think of all the polution we put out, even if every city and car was on mars it would still take hundreds of years to get enough green house gasses to get it were we need it, and i thought the martian poles were frozen co2 not water…?

Read full topic

item.title: Mars
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Mars has no magnetosphere, that’s some of the reason why it’s atmosphere is so thin. The outer edge of the atmosphere gets stripped of atoms by solar wind.

en.wikipedia.org

Magnetosphere

A magnetosphere is a region of space surrounding an astronomical object in which charged particles are manipulated or affected by that object's magnetic field. It is created by a planet having an active interior dynamo. In the space environment close to a planetary body, the magnetic field resembles a magnetic dipole. Farther out, field lines can be significantly distorted by the flow of electrically conducting plasma, as emitted from the Sun or a nearby star. e.g. the solar wind. Planets having...

Read full topic

item.title: Mars
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

Hiaburi:

that is terraforming, and to terraform mars would take a very long time, like thousands of years. and making frozen things live again isn’t that easy, we still haven’t got any woolies… but yea, i think all we would have to do is take up a ship or 2 and plants some trees since mar’s atmosphere is mainly co2, but idk the temperatures on mars so idk if trees could survive before it is terraformed.

Global warming > Temperature Increase by trapping particles (or w/e) of heat.
They did say that growing the Tree’s and such would take a long time- But, for what it’s worth it’s worth it.

I’m just repeating what scientists have said with the frozen organisms thing, you never know.

nohope:

People always said that mars was a livable planet on = )

With the right conditions.

Read full topic
